£24,000
or £20,000 without the big engine.

A genuine German built 1959 15 window deluxe Microbus.
Could easily be converted into a camper if that’s your thing, although I prefer it as a Microbus as it’s much rarer (and I have a camper anyway!)
I’ve owned this bus since October 2005. I’m finding I’m using it less and less what with work commitments and the fact that I also have another splitscreen bus.
The whole of last year, I only did 1300 miles in it.
So that’s why it’s up for sale now.

Price is firm so no lowballers/chancers. I’m not desperate to sell. If I don’t get what I want for it, it stays in my garage. Simple.

Full specification listed below.

Year: 1959
Type: Volkswagen Transporter Microbus
Body Style: 15 Window Deluxe
Colour: Metallic Grey (Lower), White (Upper)
Engine Capacity: 2332cc

Description
Manufactured on 26th July 1959 and originally sold in Los Angeles USA. Imported into the UK around June/July 2003. This type of vehicle is commonly known as a 15 window deluxe. The 15 window was a factory option variant of the 23 window deluxe, I.E. it was specially ordered from the VW factory (M Code 130) without roof skylights or sunroof fitted.
In terms of scarcity, the 15 window deluxe is much rarer than the 23 window deluxe.
Being a 59, it has bullet indicators at the front end and round rear tail/brake/indicator lights at the rear end.

The vehicle has been restored to a high specification. All rusty body panels have been replaced with the correct aftermarket repair panels. The bodywork, chassis and floor pan are all straight and virtually rust free.
The paintwork is in very good condition.
The drive train and braking system has been updated using modern technology and superior aftermarket parts.
The interior retains its original 1959 middle seat. All the interior seating has been retrimmed in matching grey velour. The door cards/panels have been retrimmed in quality grey vinyl.

Full Specification:
Engine
The engine was custom built to my specification in November 2006 at a cost of £5200.
Dyno’ed at 162bhp maximum power and 166lbft maximum torque.
The engine has done approximately 6000 miles with no mechanical problems at all.
Specification as follows:
• Bugpack Aluminium Highroof case (Shuffle pinned/Filled in behind #3/Drilled, tapped oil galleys /hand ported interior/deep #3 stud).
• C.B. Performance 84mm Nitrided crankshaft
• C.B. Performance H beam connecting rods w/ARP2000 bolts, rod ratio 5.5
• Engle cam / W125
• C.B. Performance 30mm lite weight valve lifters
• Magnum straight cut camshaft gear set
• Chromoly head studs (8mm)
• Scat Chromoly lightened flywheel
• Scat Chromloy gland nut
• Mahle 94mm Piston and Cylinder kit
• Tru-arc gudgeon pin retainers
• C.B. #1411-Wedge port/Wedgeport heads/ported,polished 44x37.5
• Manton Chromoly push rods
• Pauter roller valve rockers( 1.3 ratio)
• CB performance valve covers/vented and bolt on
• Bergmann Porsche Cooling shroud kit
• 48 IDF Weber Carburettors with C.B. port matched manifolds
• Scat center pull carb linkage
• 75 amp alternator
Additional Engine Equipment:
• MSD 6AL Ignition Module
• MSD Billet Distributor
• MSD Blaster II Ignition Coil
• MSD Spark Plug wires
• Gene Berg 30mm oil pump/steel full flow C/w Relief cover
• Scat 1 1/2 quart deep sump
• Mesa External Oil Cooler and Automatic Fan controlled by thermostat
• Gene Berg External Oil Filter with washable element
• Aeroquip FC333 oil hoses with anodised aircraft type fittings on all oil cooling and engine breathing lines
• Bugpack Engine oil breather box

Transmission
Volkswagen Beetle 1303S AT Gearbox
Ratios:
1st 3.78
2nd 2.06
3rd 1,26
4th 0.93
R 3.875
Total in 4th 3.604

Clutch
Clutch - Stage 1 plate with Daikin disc and Heavy Duty shaft kit

Suspension
Front
Creative Engineering Weedeater narrowed front beam
Creative Engineering Weedeater front dropped spindles
Spax/Creative Engineering adjustable shock absorbers
Lowered 35mm
Rear
Creative Engineering Independent Rear Suspension (IRS)
KYB shock absorbers
Lowered 35mm

Brakes
Dual circuit remote brake servo with electric vacuum pump
Front
CSP disc brakes with Porsche 5-130 bolt pattern
Rear
Creative Engineering Rear Brake drums with Porsche 5-130 bolt pattern

Wheels
5 x Porsche 14” Fuchs (original Porsche wheels) – stripped and polished/weathered

Exhaust
A1 Sidewinder Stainless Steel Exhaust
1 ¾” Ceramic Coated Merged Header

Petrol Tank
Welded aluminium lightweight high capacity petrol tank

Interior
Upholstery
All seats trimmed with quality grey velour cloth
Door cards / panels trimmed with heavy duty grey vinyl
Matching grey coach fitted carpet and floor mats
Grey dog tooth headliner
Middle seat is original 1959 specification

Windows
6 popout windows with original re-chromed ‘long spoon’ latches fitted

Gauges
Autometer Ultralite Fuel Gauge
Autometer Ultralite Oil Temperature Gauge
Autometer Ultralite Cylinder Head Temperature Gauge
Autometer Ultralite Oil Pressure Gauge
2 x Autometer Ultralite Volt Meters
Professionally Restored 1959 Speedometer
Autometer Autogage 5” Tachometer with shift light

Stereo
Original Blaupunkt Push Button Radio in dash
Sony CDX-M800 MD/CD/Aux Head Unit
Shark SCA-2260 (260 watt) Amplifier
Rockford Fosgate 6 x 9 Speakers

Alarm / Immobiliser
Cobra 7925 Thatcham Cat 1 Alarm and Immobiliser

Fire Extinguishing System
Firetec engine bay mounted automatic fire extinguishing system

Other
Rare original factory fitted ‘ambulance’ fan (M Code 121)
Leisure battery with split charging system

Call me on 07866 607216 or send a PM.
